h1: Free image resizer tool for linkedin
h2: Upload and resize your image for linkedin in one click
TITLE: Resize image for linkedin | Online Image resizer tool
META: Looking for a free and online image resizer for  linkedin? Visit our website and resize image for linkedin in few seconds.

TEXTUAL_CONTENT.content: Our free LinkedIn Image Resizer tool is very simple to use. You don't need any prior knowledge. You don't even need to sign up. Just upload the image, choose from the 13 LinkedIn image sizes as required and voila! You'll be done.
The LinkedIn Image Resizer feature is free to use for anybody and everybody. You don't need to pay us to use it. You can use it to resize your LinkedIn images as per your requirements.
Our Image Resizer feature is completely web-based. That is why, it provides our users cross-platform support. So it can be used across all types of devices and all Operating systems.
All of your data and files are deleted right away after you are done. Our online free tool doesn't save any of the user data. So it is completely trustworthy and safe.

Ours is the most comprehensive tool for resizing LinkedIn photos according to your requirements. Whether you want your photo to be as per the size of LinkedIn profile picture, or tab image, or for the stories, we have it all. And our tool will work in a very fast and efficient manner.

Our LinkedIn Image Resizer tool has multiple resizing options available. Based on how you want your picture to be resized, there are 13 generic options that we provide according to the different picture types possible in LinkedIn. You can choose one or multiple options.

HOW_TO_CONTENT.heading: How to resize your images
steps: Upload the image that you want to resize to our LinkedIn Image Resizer.
Select the appropriate size or multiple sizes as per your needs.
Hit the download all to download all available sizes.
Hit the download selected button to download selected image sizes. That's all you need to do!

FAQ.question: How to resize photo for LinkedIn?
FAQ.answer: Once you upload the picture on LinkedIn Image Resizer from safeimagekit.com you can zoom in / zoom out using two finger scroll to cale to fit LinkedIn. Once you are satisfied with the fit, click on download to download your picture.

FAQ.question: Can I resize image for LinkedIn post?
FAQ.answer: Once you upload the picture on LinkedIn Image Resizer from safeimagekit.com, select the option LinkedIn post among all the options available. Click on download, your image will be resized to LinkedIn post size.

FAQ.question: How to resize an image for LinkedIn background?
FAQ.answer: To resize a picture to fit LinkedIn background, Just go to our website, LinkedIn Image Resizer, to fix your LinkedIn Profile picture size. Upload your picture and you can see how exactly your picture will look as LinkedIn Background. If you still need to made adjustments, click on edit and make the required adjustments. Download the picture once you are happy with the image.

Upload your picture and you can see how exactly your picture will look as LinkedIn banner. If you still need to made adjustments, click on edit and make the required adjustments. Download the picture once you are happy with the image.

FAQ.question: How can I adjust the width of the image using the Linkedin image resizer feature from safeimagekit.com?
FAQ.answer: The first step of all, upload the image which requires an edit. The next step includes adjusting the important parameters of the image, this includes adjusting the width. Now, to access this option you need to select a category from all the versions and hit the edit option to begin the editing then, there will be a pop-up wherein you can drag in and adjust the width of the image. The bonus option is that we can zoom in and out, to control the required content of the image just by scrolling in and out.

FAQ.answer: The first step of all, upload the image which requires an edit. The next step includes adjusting the important parameters of the image, this includes adjusting the height. Now, to access this option you need to select a category from all the versions and hit the edit option to begin the editing then, there will be a pop-up wherein you can drag in and adjust the height of the image. FAQ.question: How can I resize an image using the Linkedin image resizer feature from safeimagekit.com?
FAQ.answer:
There are 6 steps that the user can refer to while resizing an image file,
These include-
-	Upload the image file which requires a change.
-	Select the required category of the image from the options provided.
-	Hit edit, to start adjusting the image by its height and width.
-	If you like multiple image categories, just select them by clicking a box on the top right corner of each image version.
-	Hit the “download selected” to download a particular/multiple versions.
-	Hit the “download all” to download all the image versions out there.

FAQ.question: Does the resize option of the Linkedin image resizer feature from safeimagekit.com provide any type of preview after resizing the uploaded image file?
FAQ.answer: No, currently the resizing feature of photo splitter from safeimagekit.com does not provide any kind of preview of the sections of the uploaded image, because sometimes the sections of the uploaded image go overboard and it becomes very difficult for the browser to handle the preview of each section of the image but, the image can be viewed after the editing is done and can be downloaded. Though, updates to the website in the future will add all the exciting features.

FAQ.question: Can I use the Linkedin image resizer feature from safeimagekit.com on my Windows 8?
FAQ.answer: The Linkedin image resizer feature is a versatile feature offered by safeimagekit.com which is supported by all the operating systems out there such as Windows 8, Linux, and even Ubuntu. All it takes is a device to open the extension file using the www.safeimagekit.com website and a normal internet connection to stand on. The fun fact is that it can even run on a slower internet connection.

FAQ.question: Can I use the Linkedin image resizer feature from safeimagekit.com on my Android device?
FAQ.answer: Yes, the Linkedin image resizer feature from safeimagekit.com is a cross-platform-based feature where the user can use this converter tool from operating systems such as Android, iOS, Windows, and Mac OS. FAQ.question: Do we have to use any additional software to download the modified images after conversion using the Linkedin image resizer feature from safeimagekit.com?
FAQ.answer: No, the users after resizing their image by modifying their respective image parameters, can hit the download the option which is given below and can download the modified image. FAQ.question: What will happen to our progress if we refresh our browser while we are using the Linkedin image resizer tool from safeimagekit.com?
FAQ.answer: The Linkedin image resizer tool from safeimagekit.com is not connected to any server out there, so the data which the user is working on will not be stored anywhere and as a result, it will be erased instantly when the user refreshes the browser which he is working on. The image file which is being converted will also be removed after the user exits or closes the tab on which the extension page of the website is open.

FAQ.question: Can we resize the image files which are locked, using the Linkedin image resizer feature from safeimagekit.com?
FAQ.answer: No, we cannot upload the image file which is locked as the access to that image file is blocked. So, to use the Linkedin image resizer feature from safeimagekit.com we need to upload the image files which are not locked. But the user can check the password finder extension from safeimagekit.com which is exclusively made for unlocking image as well as image files in case the user loses his password for his locked image file.

FAQ.question: Will my uploaded image files corrupt after resizing the image files using The Linkedin image resizer file feature from safeimagekit.com?
FAQ.answer: No, safeimagekit.com is built with all the latest programs and security features which does not allow the uploaded image files to corrupt. So, the uploaded image files are completely safe and secured.
